headline: Visa Faces Mexican Setback While Pursuing Growth In Latin America
summary: Visa’s proposed acquisition of a controlling stake in Mexican payment processor Prosa was blocked by Mexico’s antitrust regulator on competition grounds. At the same time, Visa plans to acquire Argentine payment firms Prisma Medios de Pago and Newpay to expand its presence in Latin American digital payments. The mix of regulatory pushback in Mexico and expansion efforts in Argentina highlights a complex period for Visa’s regional growth plans. For investors watching NYSE:V, these...
